body:
Lastly, also in syscall_getprocaddress, if c.n is set to 5 (not 2), it also
works. Does that just push more values onto the stack?

On Sun, Jul 5, 2015 at 6:28 AM Daniel Theophanes <kardianos@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Yeah, go ahead and revert, especially to try to turn the builder green;
> amd64 should be using that method anyway. My one concern is that on Windows
> 7 I recently ran into an issue where I was using lxn/walk and it was
> crashing without a dump or trace of any kind (running tip). I'm not sure if
> it is the same issue or not, but it does concern my that I didn't get a
> dump of any kind. I'll see if I can get a test case for that.
>
>
> On Sun, Jul 5, 2015 at 2:28 AM Alex Brainman <notifications@github.com>
> wrote:
>
>> @kardianos <https://github.com/kardianos> I am out of ideas. I suggest
>> we revert https://go-review.googlesource.com/#/c/8165 and, if it works
>> on your builder, we forget this whole thing until it bites us next time.
>>
>> What do you think?
>>
>> Alex
